channel.title: Paying for help
channel.description:
i have been trying for the last few days to upload my server i built <Zenith Based> But when i go to the url thats supposed to launch it it doesnt launch. i am at my gfs and heading home now. But if anyone can fix this issue. i will pay 5$ paypal to. im sure its simple. i just dont know what im doing wrong.
This is my first client Hosted on a website. and idk whether to leave it on local host. or make my client connect my Web domains IP.<Web Host> i also am not 100% sure where to find my SERVERS ip and if i leave it on local host.
All in all. im good at coding not publishing. i work with Java. not HTML...
Add me on skype if you wish to help.
Skype : michaelaarronstrickland
i will be home within the hour or so. thank you

jessessoulmate:

okay. lol thx =)

Anytime.

Read full topic

item.title: Paying for help
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

jessessoulmate:

oh well that is dumb. hmm okay so i need a no-ip then open my ports and change Just the uploaded Jar to my No-ip?

No-IP isn’t needed, you’ll need to port-forward (open your ports). Then, go to http://whatsmyip.org and paste your IP for your server ip. As long as the server is running, it’ll work.

EDIT:
No-IP is for taking your IP something like 111.222.333.444 and converting it into something that may be easier to remember, like server.no-ip.org. It also creates an extra step for security, in protecting your IP. No-IP literally means No IP Address, or in other words, hiding it. (Even though it’s still easy to get an IP.)

Read full topic

item.title: Paying for help
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“jessessoulmate, post:3, topic:460918”]so i cant host the whole server on the website of mine?
lemme reword that…
WEB host.[/quote]

It’s for hosting website, you can host the client files, and the webclient on the webhost/website. The server must be elsewhere. Hypothetically, you can, but web host providers don’t usually allow it. Can’t think of any that do, it involves being given a GUI of some sort, and being able to launch the server. Also, they’re built and structured for hosting websites.

Read full topic

item.title: Paying for help
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Moparscape does allow compensation for someones help.

On Topic…
Can you post the HTML code for your applet/client?
And also, leave your server IP alone. The IP is the IP of whatever computer the server is hosted on, not website IP. Localhost/127.0.0.1/0.0.0.0 will only work for you. Change this to your external IP, the string of numbers your computer uses to communicate with other computers, basically. http://whatsmyip.org

Read full topic
